cash in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make a profit from a situation in a way that other people think is wrong or unfair
cash in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The record company was trying to cash in on her fame by releasing early teenage recordings.
cash in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to exchange something such as an insurance policy for its value in money
cash in.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to profit from a situation, sometimes in a way that other people may consider wrong or unfair
cash in.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Counterfeiters are trying to cash in on the huge demand for Levi jeans.
cash in.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to exchange an investment for cash
cash in.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: A cut in Spanish interest rates caused him to cash in his Spanish government bonds.
Computer-related shares, which have been strong performers lately, fell as investors cashed in gains (=to receive their profits).
cash in.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to sell all your investment in something
